website_summaries.verdict: Those who are looking for a light and flexible hiking gear may consider checking out this KEEN product. It was complimented for delivering immediate comfort and for having a tacky outsole and warm interior.However, it still was not able to evade criticisms. Overall it can be said that the KEEN Targhee III Waterproof Mid is an affordable hiker that can please beginners and seasoned hikers alike in their on-trail adventures. Its questionable durability, however, is something that might make potential buyers take a step back.
pros: More than a handful of testers were delighted with the lightness of the KEEN Targhee III Waterproof Mid
Its ankle support was appreciated by some hikers
A significant number of users commend the comfortable feel of this mid-cut hiker
Several owners lauded the flexibility of this mid-cut day hiking boot
They loved how it allowed them to move freely
A couple of gear critics liked its budget-friendly price
The warmth of the Targhee III Waterproof Mid from KEEN was appreciated by a few hikers
According to some user reviews, it gripped well on various terrain types
Its little-to-no break-in period earned the approval of the majority
An impressed expert even mentioned that this characteristic was very rare in hiking boots
The burly toe cap of the Targhee III Waterproof Mid was praised by a professional reviewer
cons: Less than a handful of testers were frustrated with its waterproofing
They noted that leakage occurred after some wet encounters
This footgear did not breathe well, as testified by plenty of wearers
Based on a bunch of male user reviews, the wide version of the KEEN men’s Targhee III Waterproof Mid was disappointing
They noted that it still felt restrictive
Several upset online buyers declared that it has poor quality
They said that after a few months of moderate use, its sole easily wore out and separated from the rest of the boot

customer_reviews.title: Reduction in quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Keen Wanderer 18 months ago for a similar price and the quality on these is markedly inferior. Pretty much everything has suffered and the whole feel has deteriorated. It seems like now you need to pay £180+ for a decent pair of walking boots, and even then you need to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Si

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Keen Targhee. Sole on the first pair wore out after a matter of months (heavy use - walking the dog and at work). As I'd struggled to find a comfortable pair of boots, I bought another pair. Fit is wider at the toe than many boots so they fit me better; I measure an 8.5 and these in a 9 fit well. Photos taken after 6 months general use (no hiking, better treated than first pair) - once they got wet the leather on one boot went like tissue paper and disintegrated. I've continued to use them for heavier use (dog walk) and after another couple of months the soles are de-laminating.
customer_reviews.author: Notts reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of everyday lightweight boots for summer dog walking, they had to be waterproof, comfortable and modestly priced these ticked all the boxes. Have worn them for two weeks they fit like glove and the heel grip system works, they have mid size toe box, measurements available on Keen website.Have walked through long wet grass and hosed them off to clean them, no sign of water penetration so far. They look robust and the smooth Nubuck looks good after applying G-wax. Probably not the most popular colour hence a good price but who cares when they are wet and muddy!
customer_reviews.author: hiker

customer_reviews.title: The best walking boots on the market.
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Keen Targhee's, they are the most comfortable boot you can buy. I wore out my first pair out after two years of daily. My first walk in these was 10k and its as if I had been wearing them for months, no tight spots, chafing or rubbing. There is just no better boot on the market.
customer_reviews.author: redhotjag

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: I am a great fan of Keen footwear and have several pairs of various styles. I do a lot of hill walking and this pair is just perfect for most terrain. They are a great fit and extremely comfortable. They are well made with a lot of thought put into their construction.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They started to fall apart within 7 months of not very intensive wear
customer_reviews.text: They were comfortable after a couple of weeks of use and I appreciated the wide toe box and true to size fit....BUT, they started to fall apart after 7 months of use, the material at the join between the insole and the midsole just started to disintegrate. Very disappointing as previous KEEN boots have lasted 2 or more years. The quality of of KEEN stuff is lower than it used to be in my opinion. I would not recommend them. Returned to vendor and awaiting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In my experience Better buy from the high street or direct from Keen.
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased these from Amazon, having tried them previously in a highstreet shop, I found the right shoe looked different and was tighter. I sent them back. I decided to buy direct from Keen, more expensive, however both boots fit perfectly. from the Amazon seller the left boot appeared to be wide fit and right boot standard. Be careful if you need wide fit as I suspect the right had been swapped or packed by mistake. I decide to buy direct from Keen knowing my size because Cotswold outdoor didn't stock the targhee 3 exp.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby

customer_reviews.title: Men's Targhee Mid iii.
customer_reviews.text: First time using Keen after being recommended. Very very comfortable boots. No more tired feet. Very breathable & highly waterproof. Highly recommended..
customer_reviews.author: Davy

customer_reviews.title: ok just more chinese crap i suppose
customer_reviews.text: this is my first pair of walking boots my feet are shot to bits now (health problems) i need wide fitting and ordered 8.5 for size 8 foot. No they are not wide fitting and they only just fit. would not be able to put thick socks on. i know i would have to get used to a new type of boot/shoe but these are not comfortable from first try. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Short person (yeah, right)

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Targhee2's
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy. Not as good as the Targhee2's . I would advise to buy the Targhee 2 if they are still available. Soles not too good. Bad quality and poor grip.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Keen Targhee
customer_reviews.text: Liked the boots- good quality- good value for money. Haven't had Keen boots before- bought in my usual size but too big . Have returned the boots but am looking to try on in store somewhere, so I can buy 'again' but correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: A reliable pair of well-fitting boots
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these boots we've bought ... solely because the first pair wore out after many miles!! These boots are a good fit, comfortable, and reliable. There is nothing shoddy about them. They still looked good after all those miles.
customer_reviews.author: Elvenone

customer_reviews.title: Light, wide fitting waterproof boot
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Waterproof and don't need wearing in. No blisters. Ideal for walkers with wide feet. They are also exceptionally light for a boot. Could definitely last longer, but probably the price you pay for the lightness.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: My feet are wide and these boots are comfortable. I specifically wanted wide fit and waterproof. So far they are living up to the recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Mr David Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sure footed boot
customer_reviews.text: 16 years of wearing keen boots, these fit right out of the box. Too early to say how they wear, but I expect them to last.
customer_reviews.author: MR.C

customer_reviews.title: Great books, poor materials?
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfy, and with a wide fit. They are great for walking long distances, and gardening work. Make sure to dry them and keep them clear of mud. The siding materials, as many others have commented, are not durable...leading to splitting between the siding and the sole, which is a shame. It could be better as leather?
customer_reviews.author: holly

customer_reviews.title: Very good boots, would recommend them to other hillwalkers
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for these boots which fit very well, and arrived promptly and in good condition. Can't wait to get out onto the hills with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: R H Turner

customer_reviews.title: My 5th Pair
customer_reviews.text: Great walking boots. I've tried others but always come back to Keen Targhee.
customer_reviews.author: CJW

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant boots, and fantastic service from Gaynor Sports. Would definitely recommend both boots and vendor
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Neale

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with these boots, nicely made and they look good too.
customer_reviews.author: sharker

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These are really good shoes, and light. They are comfortable a good for and waterprof. I will update this in a month or so, but for now, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Spyboy

customer_reviews.title: It’s more about product quality, seller and delivery Great
customer_reviews.text: Keen shoes have become crap, I’ve owned quite a few over the years and the quality has deteriorated. This year I have gone through two pairs with only moderate use. Soles detaching from upper and and a breakdown of materials of the upper part of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rueben G

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with this product. Fits well and is very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I have a very broad forefoot, and these boots - while broad - still give fantastic support. Comfortable straight from the box; and durable. My third pair.
customer_reviews.author: Joh Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: wide fitting ,fits well , used for walking very good ..
customer_reviews.text: very good , well fitted and comfy to walk miles in ...
customer_reviews.author: james morrison

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, ordered 1/2 size up from my normal fit. well made and very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Ian Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Very good value and a very good brand
customer_reviews.text: Left boot is causing a lot of friction at ankle level
customer_reviews.author: Colm Power

customer_reviews.title: Keen - Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these for more than 10 years which I replaced Around a year ago and because I had been so pleased with my old pair I also bought my wife a pair. My wife’s pair split around 2 months ago and mine have also now split in exactly the same place - see photo I’m not sure what the warranty period is but these are not the same boots that Keen used to supply - poor quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: S. Mccloud

customer_reviews.title: repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for my beloved old trail shoes which had served me well, I hated to give them up but I was happy to find essentially the same boots available on line! Very happy camper!! Light weight, waterproof, grippy soles, the extra room in the toe box were as I remembered from my first purchase in 2014 (OMGoodness!) Thanks Keen for continuing to make a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart after five months
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit with wide toe box and great performance in the wet. An excellent boot overall which sadly fell apart after five months. The upper separated from the instep of the sole on both boots rendering them useless. I have just got a refund for mine. Took a long time over buying these Keen shoes as Five Ten are now rubbish as well. These are poorly made like every other formerly reliable branded walking shoe and did not last as long as a £25 pair from Sports Direct (which took seven months to wear out). Dreadful, and one star for the guarantee which you will need when they fail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good But Flawed
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Targhee's , light to wear and no need to break in. However, both pairs failed after exactly one year of wear and in the same place, where the leather side upper meets the moulded upstand of the sole they split. Did treat them and clean them but after giving them a good go won't buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gains

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Targhee Iii Mid Wp High Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: Keen hiking shoe for men, the targhee iii mid, is an updated version of the Keen original targhee and targhee ii. The hiking shoe is waterproof, but breathable and supports your feet and ankle, while hiking, to the fullest. Now it comes in a rugged look. More features: keen.Dry® waterproof, breathable membrane, leather mud shield offers resilient durability, speed hooks, for easy lace adjustment, injected tpu heel-capture system for stability, ESS shank offers lightweight support, resilient, internal shank, 4mm multi-directional lugs for traction, clean sport next™ for natural odor control, environmentally-preferred premium leather from lwg-certified tannery.
feature_bullets: Leather Upper - Offers a wide range of protection for your feet.
Performance Mesh Upper - Swathes the foot in lightweight, breathable support.
Keen.Dry - A waterproof and breathable membrane.
Leather Mud Shield - Protects the feet from a build-up of mud.
TPU Heel Capture - Locks in the heel.
